Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with three bands in added white; exterior, from top: part of guilloche pattern; maeander frieze between bands lined with dilute lines; lotus flower.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.419. For parallels regarding the lotus at the bottom, see Lemos 1991, no. 114 from Emporio. Lemos places sherd 1924,1201.419 in the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl, in which there is a greater variety in the filling ornaments, similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 75). As both sherds belong to the same vase, 1924,1201.531 also belongs to this group.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 239, no. 190)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0373) (phase 2)
